bio.short: S.I.D. is an Italian sludge/doom metal trio formed in 2019, recognized for their heavy and hypnotic sound combining doom and sludge elements. The band features Fra, Ikea, and Pikkio, known for a strong yet thoughtful musical style.
bio.review:
Line-up
Fra – vocals, guitars, lyrics
Ikea – guitars, bass, samples
Pikkio – drums

Collaborations
Beatrice Marata – viola (on City Of Chemistry)

Selected Discography
Architects Of Armageddon (2019)
City Of Chemistry EP (2022)
Over The Pain split tape with Deshuesadero (2023)

Trivia
S.I.D. are not just a band, but a project that deeply reflects on the contradictions of our time, from war to pollution, touching on collective and personal pain. Their music is a powerful protest but also an invitation to reflection and resistance.
bio.extended:
S.I.D. is a sludge/doom metal trio from Italy, active since 2019 and known for their oppressive and hypnotic sound, capable of blending dense doom atmospheres with the corrosive heaviness of sludge. The band consists of Fra (vocals, guitars, lyrics), Ikea (guitars, bass, samples), and Pikkio (drums), a lineup distinguished by a musical approach that is both powerful and conceptual.

Their first album, Architects Of Armageddon (2019), received widespread acclaim in the underground scene, highlighting their ability to build a devastating yet reflective sound, where apocalyptic, war-related, and environmental themes intertwine with a suffocating and hypnotic musical fabric.

In 2022, with the EP City Of Chemistry, S.I.D. further deepened their dark and political imagery, inspired by Gianluca Di Feo’s book Veleni di Stato (“State Poisons”). The record represents the second part of a trilogy dedicated to the atrocities of war, focusing on chemical weapons and their deadly impact. The EP, produced by the band and recorded at V.A.N.G.A. studio, combines slow, massive riffs, deep growls, and tight rhythms, enriched by viola passages that add a melancholic and theatrical atmosphere.

In 2023, S.I.D. expanded their collaborative horizon with the release of the split tape Over The Pain, made together with the Mexican hardcore punk/sludge band Deshuesadero from Mexico City. This international collaboration, released by Terror Casets, Wrong Disk Records, and Nido de Ratas, highlights the dialogue between two distant underground scenes united by the same emotional intensity and urgency to overcome pain through music.

Over The Pain is a work that explores suffering as both a universal and personal condition, a "membrane to cross" to find new inner strength and rise again. S.I.D.’s tracks, “Downhill” and “Void,” intertwine with the aggressive and tension-filled songs of Deshuesadero, creating a project that speaks of resilience and struggle in a hostile world.

Musically, S.I.D. have become a point of reference in the European doom/sludge scene, with a sound ranging from the funeral doom’s funeral pace to the abrasive crust punk touches, always maintaining a strong evocative character and a deeply conceptual core. Their live shows are immersive experiences, blending heavy sound and dark atmospheres, able to take the listener on a journey through human catastrophes and post-apocalyptic soundscapes.

merch.name: S.I.D. / Deshuesadero - Over the Pain (Split tape)
City of Chemistry - Limited Edition 12''  Vinyl

bio.short: Morsura è un trio noise/post-hardcore marchigiano-veneto nato dall'incontro tra Jacopo Pannocchia, Mattia Antonelli (Tagliabuio) e Federico Aggio (Lucertulas, Cattivi Maestri), attivo dal 2018 con sonorità telluriche e viscerali.
bio.review:
Line-up
Jacopo Pannocchia – chitarra, arti grafiche
Mattia Antonelli – batteria, chitarra (Tagliabuio)
Federico Aggio – basso, voce (Lucertulas, Cattivi Maestri)

Live guest (2024–):
Loris Cericola – chitarra, voce (Spirale)

Discografia selezionata
Selvatica (2018)

Curiosità
Il nome 'Morsura' richiama l'effetto del mordente nelle tecniche incisorie, metafora perfetta per un suono selvaggio, graffiante e profondamente espressivo. La grafica dell’album “Selvatica” è firmata dallo stesso Jacopo Pannocchia, artista visivo e membro della band.
bio.extended:
Morsura è un progetto noise/post-hardcore nato dall’unione di tre musicisti provenienti da Marche e Veneto: Jacopo Pannocchia, artista visivo e chitarrista; Mattia Antonelli, batterista e chitarrista attivo anche nei Tagliabuio; Federico Aggio, cantante/bassista dei Lucertulas e collaboratore nei Cattivi Maestri di Pierpaolo Capovilla.

Il gruppo esordisce nel 2018 con l’album *Selvatica*, un lavoro che fonde brutalità sonora e tensione emotiva, caratterizzato da un’estetica grafica potente curata da Pannocchia stesso. Il nome 'Morsura', che in incisione indica l'azione chimica sulla lastra, simboleggia perfettamente la loro attitudine sonora: diretta, mordente e profondamente materica.

Nel 2024 la band annuncia l’ingresso nei live di Loris Cericola (Spirale), giovane chitarrista marchigiano, che ha debuttato dal vivo il 5 luglio al Rock al Grot, Parco delle Grotte di Labante (BO).

bio.short: Le Risorse Umane sono una band post-punk / new wave nata sulla direttrice che divide Milano e Ancona, con sonorità ispirate agli anni '80, '90 e 2000, filtrate da una poetica urbana e disillusa.
bio.review: Il trio composto da Valerio Alessandrini (voce, testi), Jacopo Mazzoni e Alessandro Rivi (musica), presenta l’EP *Con Effetto Immediato* (2025, Notturno Dischi), un lavoro che amplia l’estetica new wave del gruppo con urgenza lirica e precisione cinematografica. Tra malinconia e disincanto urbano, la band esplora un post-punk contemporaneo, alternando chitarre fredde e sintetizzatori puliti. Tra le influenze: Offlaga Disco Pax, Massimo Volume, Diaframma.
